channel.title: Posts on Trey Fritz Github site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Trey Fritz Github site

item.title: Robert Williams, a.k.a. TimeLord, Has Emerged and Could Very Well Win DPOY Next Season
item.description: Robert Williams was drafted in 2018 with the 27th pick in the 1st round by the Boston Celtics. It was a bit of a rough start for Williams, missing his flight to Boston after the draft lead him to missing his first practice. After this slip up a few of his fellow Celtics decided to give him the nickname TimeLord, and it has stuck ever since. After missing that flight things started to get much better for Rob, while his numbers through his first couple years didn’t blow anyone away he would make his presence known in the small amount of minutes he was getting.

item.title: Why the Boston Celtics are going to win the 2023 NBA Championship
item.description: The Boston Celtics started the NBA season with high hopes and title aspirations, but the first half of the seaon had many Celtics fans looking for answers. With a record of 17-19 before the start of the new year the Celtics were disappointing everyone. Somehting clicked in January, nobody is sure what happened, but some credit a Tweet from Celtics star Jaylen Brown that said, “The energy is about to shift”.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
